meanings.definition: To make someone feel excited or lightheaded.
meanings.sent1: The surprise party giddied her with joy.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster ride giddied the children.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics giddied the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop giddied the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected win giddied the team beyond belief.

meanings.sent1: She giddied up as the concert began.
meanings.sent2: The children giddied up at the sight of the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent3: The thought of the upcoming vacation giddied him up.
meanings.sent4: The thrilling plot twist in the movie giddied up the audience.
meanings.sent5: The news of the promotion giddied up the employee for days.
